The symptoms of malaria can begin within 2 to 3 days after infection, and can include fever, chills, headache, muscle and joint pain, fatigue, nausea, and vomiting. In severe cases, malaria can cause anemia, seizures, coma, and even death.

To prevent malaria, it is important to take certain precautions when traveling to areas where the disease is common. These precautions include using insecticide-treated bed nets, wearing protective clothing, applying insect repellent, and avoiding outdoor activities during peak mosquito hours (usually at dawn and dusk). If you suspect you may have been exposed to malaria or are experiencing symptoms, it is important to seek medical attention immediately.
